sense.name: a boundary or endpoint of a region
sense.commentary: LIMIT[+location][+region][+boundary][+end] Note: refers to a physical location that serves as a boundary or border.
sense.examples: They bought a house outside the city limits. The shipping vessel was outside the three-mile limit recognized by international law.

sense.name: the utmost extent possible or allowed, a constraint
sense.examples: Each athlete will be striving to the limits of his or her ability. Mary got a ticket for driving twenty miles an hour over the speed limit. There is some controversy over the limits of presidential powers. The speakers will have a fifteen-minute limit for presentations, leaving five minutes for questions. Congress may raise the ceiling again on the debt limit. There are no limits to what that child can imagine!

sense.name: in mathematics, a value that a function converges on
sense.examples: The problem asked to find the limit L for the function f(x), as values for x approached the value c. The students learned about limits in their introductory calculus class.

sense.name: an exasperating or intolerable situation
sense.commentary: LIMIT[+state][+exasperating] Note: an informal extension of Sense 2
sense.examples: Betty's mother tried everyone's patience to the limits during the rehearsal dinner for the wedding. His treatment of that waiter was the absolute limit!
